summary: The house centipede, *Scutigera coleoptrata*, is a yellowish-grey centipede with up to 15 pairs of long legs. It originally comes from the Mediterranean but now lives in many parts of the world, often in people's homes. These centipedes eat other insects and spiders. They are helpful in controlling pest populations but might startle homeowners due to their rapid movements and large number of legs.
title: Scutigera coleoptrata
